intro: Memecylon corymbiforme, commonly known as the clustered memecylon, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other economically important trees. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves, which are typically opposite and have a feathery appearance. Its small, yellowish-green flowers are clustered in corymbs, giving it its common name. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds.
